CHAPTER XXIV.

OF THE DIVISION 01⁴* THE SILVER FOR THE WORK.

Tms being purified, if you wish to fabricate a chalice, divide the silver equally in two, and keep one half for making the foot and the plate; from the other you make the cup, to which you add *a portion from the part of the plate3 for ex— ample, if there be a mark of silver, add to the half the weight of twelve nummi, which you will afterwards file and serape, that you may give it to its portion. But should there be more or less silver, you add, according to its quantity, and after- wards you restore its weight to each part.
